schemes.name: Beti Bachao Beti Padhao
schemes.benefits: Awareness and improvement in the welfare of the girl child, funds for education, and survival
schemes.eligibility: Open to families with a girl child; focus on districts with low Child Sex Ratio

schemes.name: Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana
schemes.benefits: High-interest savings account for girl child's education and marriage expenses
schemes.eligibility: Girls below 10 years; family income restrictions for tax benefits under Section 80C

schemes.name: Scheduled Caste Post-Matric Scholarship
schemes.benefits: Tuition fee reimbursement and living allowances
schemes.eligibility: SC students pursuing post-matric education; family income below ₹2.5 lakh annually

schemes.name: Saksham Scholarship
schemes.benefits: ₹50,000 annual scholarship for differently-abled students
schemes.eligibility: Differently-abled students with family income below ₹8 lakh annually; enrolled in technical courses

schemes.name: Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS)
schemes.benefits: Health, nutrition, preschool education, and vaccination for children and pregnant women
schemes.eligibility: Open to children under 6 years, pregnant/lactating women in rural or urban slum areas

schemes.name: National Means-cum-Merit Scholarship (NMMSS)
schemes.benefits: ₹12,000 per annum for students in Class IX to XII
schemes.eligibility: Students scoring at least 55% in Class VIII; family income below ₹1.5 lakh annually

schemes.name: Prime Minister's Special Scholarship Scheme
schemes.benefits: Financial aid for higher education in professional courses
schemes.eligibility: Students from J&K pursuing higher education outside the state

schemes.name: Midday Meal Programs
schemes.benefits: Free cooked meals to improve enrollment and reduce hunger
schemes.eligibility: Students in government and government-aided primary schools

schemes.name: Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalaya
schemes.benefits: Residential schooling for girls from disadvantaged groups
schemes.eligibility: Girls from SC/ST/OBC/minority communities in educationally backward blocks

schemes.name: Balika Samriddhi Yojana
schemes.benefits: Cash incentives for girl child's education
schemes.eligibility: Girls born in families below the poverty line

schemes.name: Samagra Shiksha
schemes.benefits: Financial support for school education and teacher training
schemes.eligibility: All students from government schools, especially from disadvantaged groups

schemes.name: Mukhyamantri Rajshri Yojana
schemes.benefits: Financial incentives for girls at birth, enrollment in school, and higher education
schemes.eligibility: Girls born in Rajasthan to families with income below a certain threshold

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana (PMKVY)
schemes.benefits: Free skill training and certification for employment
schemes.eligibility: Youth aged 18–35 years; priority for underprivileged and unemployed individuals

schemes.name: Scheme of Apprenticeship Training
schemes.benefits: Stipend and practical training opportunities
schemes.eligibility: Students pursuing higher education or vocational courses

schemes.name: Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan
schemes.benefits: Universal access to free elementary education
schemes.eligibility: All children aged 6–14 years

schemes.name: Rashtriya Madhyamik Shiksha Abhiyan (RMSA)
schemes.benefits: Improvement in secondary education infrastructure and access
schemes.eligibility: Students in government and government-aided secondary schools

schemes.name: Free and Compulsory Education
schemes.benefits: Right to free education under RTE Act
schemes.eligibility: All children aged 6–14 years in India

schemes.name: CBSE Udaan Scheme
schemes.benefits: Free study material and resources for girls in engineering aspirants
schemes.eligibility: Girls enrolled in Class XI and XII; family income below ₹6 lakh annually

schemes.name: Nanda Devi Kanya Yojana
schemes.benefits: Financial support for the education and welfare of girl children
schemes.eligibility: Girls born in Uttarakhand to families below the poverty line

schemes.name: Pre-Matric Scholarship to SC Students
schemes.benefits: Financial assistance for SC students in Classes IX and X
schemes.eligibility: SC students with family income below ₹2 lakh annually

schemes.name: Integrated Child Protection Scheme (ICPS)
schemes.benefits: Aims to improve the well-being of children in difficult circumstances and reduce vulnerabilities
schemes.eligibility: Children in vulnerable and difficult circumstances

schemes.name: Rajiv Gandhi Scheme for Empowerment of Adolescent Girls (SABLA)
schemes.benefits: Focuses on the all-round development of adolescent girls aged 11-18 years through education and vocational training
schemes.eligibility: Adolescent girls aged 11-18 years, especially from disadvantaged backgrounds

schemes.name: Indira Gandhi Matritva Sahyog Yojana (IGMSY)
schemes.benefits: A conditional cash transfer scheme for pregnant and lactating women to improve health and nutrition
schemes.eligibility: Pregnant and lactating women meeting specific health and income criteria

schemes.name: National Child Labour Project (NCLP)
schemes.benefits: Aims to withdraw children from hazardous occupations and mainstream them into formal education
schemes.eligibility: Children engaged in hazardous labor, aged 9-14 years

schemes.name: Mid-Day Meal Scheme
schemes.benefits: Provides nutritious meals to school children to enhance enrollment and retention in schools
schemes.eligibility: Students in government and government-aided schools

schemes.name: National Scheme for Incentives to Girls for Secondary Education (NSIGSE)
schemes.benefits: Encourages girls from SC/ST communities to pursue secondary education with financial incentives
schemes.eligibility: Girls from SC/ST communities enrolled in secondary education

schemes.name: Ladli Lakshmi Yojana
schemes.benefits: Provides financial support for the education of girls from economically weaker backgrounds in Madhya Pradesh
schemes.eligibility: Girls born in Madhya Pradesh to families meeting economic criteria

schemes.name: Majhi Kanya Bhagyashree Scheme
schemes.benefits: Offers financial assistance for the education of girls in Maharashtra
schemes.eligibility: Families with girl children in Maharashtra, especially economically weaker sections

schemes.name: Gharaunda (Group Home for Adults)
schemes.benefits: Aims at providing care for adults with disabilities, indirectly supporting their educational needs through vocational training
schemes.eligibility: Adults with disabilities requiring residential care and skill development

schemes.name: Gyan Prabha
schemes.benefits: Provides educational support for persons with disabilities pursuing vocational courses leading to employment
schemes.eligibility: Persons with disabilities pursuing vocational training

schemes.name: PM CARES for Children
schemes.benefits: Financial support and educational assistance for children who lost parents due to COVID-19
schemes.eligibility: Children orphaned due to COVID-19

schemes.name: DISHA (Early Intervention and School Readiness Scheme)
schemes.benefits: Supports early intervention for children with disabilities aged 0-10 years
schemes.eligibility: Children with disabilities aged 0-10 years

schemes.name: VIKAAS (Day Care)
schemes.benefits: Daycare facilities aimed at enhancing skills of persons with disabilities transitioning into adulthood
schemes.eligibility: Persons with disabilities requiring daycare facilities

schemes.name: SAMARTH (Respite Care)
schemes.benefits: Provides respite care services for orphans and persons with disabilities from low-income families
schemes.eligibility: Orphans and persons with disabilities from low-income families

schemes.name: Prerna (Marketing Assistance)
schemes.benefits: Supports marketing products made by persons with disabilities, fostering skill development and empowerment through entrepreneurship
schemes.eligibility: Persons with disabilities engaged in entrepreneurial activities
